page.title: 04CRAIGTON SMIDDY
page.content: There have been 3 generations of Drummonds in the Smiddy.Mr Robert Drummond told us it was mainly shoeing horses they used to do but they did repairing of farm implements and putting iron rims on cart wheels as well.Then, they would use iron but now mild steel is used since iron is hard to get .Being a blacksmith now is much easier than it used to be.In the old days the Smiddy was used as a place of meeting in Craigton. When we visited it, they were making a large metal box for Hilton Park Golf Course to keep petrol in.They also make gates and fences, some nicely decorated. Hardly any horses are shoed now.
